name: wood preservative production, creosote | wood preservative, creosote | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/3286/documentation

This dataset represents the production of one kg of tar-oil creosote WEI type C ( Grade C according to EN 13991 ) to be used as wood preservative. Creosote WEI type C has been optimized with regard to low-volatile and highly volatile components and contains comparably low levels of benzo[a] pyrene. Due to the reduction in highly volatile compoments, odour impacts are reduced as compared to other types of creosote.;In the process of coal-tar distillation, the distillate is collected into four fractions; the 'light oil', which remains lighter than water, the 'middle oil' which passes over when the light oil is removed; the 'heavy oil', which sinks; and the 'anthracene oil', which when cold is mostly solid and greasy, of a buttery consistence. Creosote refers to the portion of coal tar which distills as 'heavy oil', typically between 230–270°C, also called 'dead oil'; it sinks into water but still is fairly liquid.

From reception of coal tar resulting from the coking process of hard coal at the factory gate.

This acitivity ends with the creosote WEI type C at the factory gate. The dataset includes the material inputs to production, transports of those materials and available process emissions. The dataset also includes a very rough estimate of plant infrastructure
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/202:Manufacture of other chemical products/2021:Manufacture of pesticides and other agrochemical products

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data for Germany used for Europe
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Destillation of the coal tar to creosote
